headline: QUIZ: Which boisterous, blabbering, big-mouth said it? George Steinbrenner or Donald Trump
description: When it comes to filling up a reporter's notebook, few have done it better than late Yankees owner George Steinbrenner and current presidential hopeful Donald Trump. Try and match these remarks with the New York icons who blurted them out.
question: "In the end, I'll put my good acts up against anybody in this country. Anybody"
credit: New York Daily News File Photo

question: "Show me someone without an ego, and I'll show you a loser."
"Winning means everything ƒ you show me a good loser and I'll show you a loser."
credit: New York Daily News File Photo
result: 4-6 - You try, but it's just not good enough. - GS

question: "I can't tell you how many people said, 'Please buy the Mets.'"
result: 7-9 - You don't want it bad enough. You're not giving 100 percent. - GS

question: "Anyone who thinks my story is anywhere near over is sadly mistaken."
result: 10 - Winning is the most important thing in life, after breathing. - GS

question: "I am tough. Sometimes I'm unreasonable. I have to catch myself once in a while."
credit: New York Daily News File Photo

question: "Having people scream nasty things at you is a part of [life]. I've had my share of it. ƒ They can say what they want."
credit: New York Daily News File Photo

question: "I'm owned by the people. I'm no angel, but I'm gonna do right by them!"
"My dad never let me have an allowance."
credit: New York Daily News File Photo

question: "I think apologizing's a great thing, but you have to be wrong."
